title: 820-01598-A Liquid Damage (Working almost fine)
message:
Hola
Customer reported this macbook as dead, however we were able to turn it on. 
9 out 10 times the mac turns on and boots ok, 1 time wont turn on, you need to try again and it turn on. 

I will reflow the affected areas and use the ultrasonic cleaner. You think this is the correct approach? 
Also, one of the most affected areas is the U3900 zone but it has a big soldered shield, you think ultrasonic would be enough?


Thanks!!

title: 820-01598-A Liquid Damage (Working almost fine)
message: Use ultrasonic cleaner only if corrosion is extended and you can't eliminate it on the spot.

title: 820-01598-A Liquid Damage (Working almost fine)
message:
Should I remove the shield to be sure if the liquid affected U3900?

I thinks it is affected see the image

[ATTACH]60786[/ATTACH]

title: 820-01598-A Liquid Damage (Working almost fine)
message: Looks like liquid went under the shield...

title: 820-01598-A Liquid Damage (Working almost fine)
message: Any recomendation to remove the shield?

title: 820-01598-A Liquid Damage (Working almost fine)
message: Try with ultrasonic cleaner in this case.

title: 820-01598-A Liquid Damage (Working almost fine)
message:
Hello, 
I reflowed the affected aread and cleaned with ultrasonic
Then the macbook only took 5V.

I reflowed again U3200 and U3100 and the computer took 20V and turned on just 1 TIME.

What should I measure? 

C6902 and C6905 got completely destroyed, do you think these missing caps could be affecting? (Just for testing for sure)

title: 820-01598-A Liquid Damage (Working almost fine)
message:
The missing caps shouldn't be a problem; there remain more filter caps.
Not easy to repair a board with advanced corrosion...

title: 820-01598-A Liquid Damage (Working almost fine)
message:
The board is taking 5V, 0.083A then 0.123A then .083 and so on...

Any idea?

title: 820-01598-A Liquid Damage (Working almost fine)
message:
Reball U3100/200, instead of reflow.
There may be other corroded resistors, traces...

title: 820-01598-A Liquid Damage (Working almost fine)
message: I replaced U3100/200 and same issue. Worked fine for some times,  the board is taking 5V, 0.083A then 0.123A then .083 and so on...

title: 820-01598-A Liquid Damage (Working almost fine)
message:
Something more affected by corrosion.
May be accumulated crap under BGA chips, bad solders.
